bug.author: a-asterisk
bug.summary: [SOLVED] Failed opening Image Files: Cannot open Labelfiles
bug.description:
Describe the bug I want to open existing Labelfiles, which were created on a different computer but with the same labelme Version, but I get "Error opening file: a bytes-like object is required, not 'NoneType'. Make sure C:/.../f12720.json is a valid label file." In Anaconda Prompt it also says "label_file:load_image_file:52 - Failed opening image file". The image path given here is correct and exists and when I put it into the Windows explorer, it opens the correct image. When I copy the folder containing images and labelfiles into Documents it works as expected, so I think the error could be something with the limited pathlength in windows? To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Start labelme Click on 'Open Dir' and choose the directory defined in the json-file under 'imagePath' Click on 'Change Output Dir' and choose the coresponding directory with json-files See error
Expected behavior Load saved Labelfiles and display them on the images Desktop (please complete the following information):
OS: Windows10 Labelme Version 4.5.6

comments.comment: It seems like it is actually a problem of windows and its pathlength. Enabling win32 long paths within the Local Group Policy Editor solved it for me Here's a guide on how to do that: <denchmark-link:https://www.howtogeek.com/266621/how-to-make-windows-10-accept-file-paths-over-260-characters/>https://www.howtogeek.com/266621/how-to-make-windows-10-accept-file-paths-over-260-characters/</denchmark-link>
